come from somebody/something.translation: if you come from a place, you were born there or lived there when you were young
to be obtained from a place, thing, or person, or to start or be made somewhere
A lot of drugs come from quite common plants.
My information comes from a very reputable source.
to happen as the result of doing something
Most of her problems come from expecting too much of people.
used to say that someone should not criticize another person for doing something, because they have done the same thing themselves
You think I’m too selfish? That’s rich coming from you!
the basic attitude or opinion someone has, which influences what they think, say, or do
I see where you’re coming from now.
